Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Goblet
Description: Small vase in the shape of a goblet with a sphere-shaped body, small flat circular base and wide protruding lip. A fragment of the lip is missing. The whole exterior surface and the lip are covered with a brick-red slip. A white stripe also once covered the lip, inside as well as outside.
